page.title: 05EXHIBITS IN ROYAL LIBRARY
page.content: by Helen, Richard,Bradley The library at Windsor Castle is full of interesting historic and modern exhibits and these are the ones we remember most clearly :- The embroidered shirt worn by Charles I when he was beheaded. A second edition of the first book printed with some coloured text by the Gutenburg Press. The present Queen's diary at eleven years old open at a page about the coronation of her parents. A model of the Schmidt telescope erected for Edinburgh University at Monte Porzio, Italy. The pilot's gloves and anti-flash mask worn by Prince Andrew during the war in the Falklands. The hand-drawn vellum document of the Queen's consent to the marriage of Lady Diana Spencer and Prince Charles.
